name: Squat Thrust
how_to_perform:
1. Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart.

2. Lower your body into a squat, keeping your back straight and your weight evenly distributed between both legs.

3. Place your hands on the ground next to your feet, with your fingers spread wide.

4. From the squat position, kick your legs back behind you, so that you're in a plank position.

5. Then, do a push-up by lowering your body toward the ground.

6. Jump your feet forward under your body and stand up explosively, returning to the standing position.

7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Squat thrusts are an explosive plyometric exercise that targets multiple muscle groups and can be added to endurance training or cardio workouts.
alternative_names: Burpees, Bodyweight Squat Thrust, Squat Pullovers
